thread.title: British backpacker Danielle McLaughlin was 'raped and strangled to death', postmortem reveals
thread.title_full: British backpacker Danielle McLaughlin was 'raped and strangled to death', postmortem reveals

author: Steve White
title: British backpacker Danielle McLaughlin was 'raped and strangled to death', postmortem reveals
text:
British backpacker Danielle McLaughlin was 'raped and strangled to death', postmortem reveals Vikat Bhagat has been charged with murdering the 28-year-old in Goa Share Click   CCTV footage purports to show final movements before Danielle McLaughlin's murder in Goa Share this video Get daily     
British backpacker Danielle McLaughlin was 'raped and strangled to death', autopsy results revealed. 
Doctors say the 28-year-old's death was caused by "asphyxia as a result of compression of neck with craniocerebral damage consequent to injuries to face and head". 
Further tests confirmed she had been sexually assaulted before her death in the tourist hotspot on Goa. 
Yesterday, police released CCTV of Danielle’s final moments as she left a bar after a beach party. 
She is walking a few feet in front of a man police identified as the accused murderer Vikat Bhagat. Danielle's body was found on a beach (Photo: Caters) 
The local petty criminal has been charged with her murder and will appear in court again in a week’s time. 
Detectives say Danielle and Vikat bought two bottles of beer and had a row with a bar owner before driving off on a scooter at about 9.30pm on the night of her murder. 
The pair had been pictured earlier in the evening at a beach party. 
Vikat allegedly tried to cover up the murder by hiding her blood stained clothes in a backpack in a field near his house. Danielle McLaughlin who was discovered dead in Canacona (Photo: PA) 
Police also found her purse and a broken bottle nearby. 
Police are still examining his blood stained clothes and a moped found with blood on it. 
Sammy Tavares, the deputy superintendent of Canacona police, said a court had granted police permission to hold Bhagat for seven days to complete their investigation. A vigil conducted by locals and foreign nationals tourists (Photo: Caters) 
“Then we will submit a charge sheet and the case will go on,” he said. 
Danielle from Ireland but living in Liverpool and travelling on a British passport had met Bhagat on a previous trip to Goa and been “seen with this guy from the afternoon of the 13th”, the officer added. 
The 24-year-old, described by locals as a gang member, was arrested within four hours of police being alerted to the discovery of McLaughlin’s body on Tuesday morning. Danielle had been at a beach party just hours earlier (Photo: PA) Tributes left for Danielle McLaughlin murdered in Goa (Photo: Yogita Limaye) Police investigate Danielle's murder (Photo: Caters) 
On further investigations, he confessed of having [been] involved in the gruesome murder of the innocent lady,” he said. 
McLaughlin’s clothing was found near the crime scene on Wednesday and Taveres said the investigation was now focused on finding her mobile phone. 
Criticism of the police handling of the case emerged after a British national living in the area was asked to help identify Danielle. The Ourem Shack in the Agonda festival village, Goa, India where Danielle McLaughlin was last seen (Photo: Caters) Tributes left for Danielle McLaughlin murdered in Goa (Photo: Yogita Limaye) 
Saskia Gall said there had been significant “contamination of evidence” at the crime scene. 
“We went out to the field and there were about 30 or more men standing next to the body taking photos and watching,” she said. 
She also questioned police claims that McLaughlin had been found in a pool of blood. “There are a tonne of holes in the police story and I know for a fact this is not the end of it,” she said. Video Loading Click
